intro: Monanthotaxis letestui, commonly known as the Letestu's monostemon, is a rare flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Monostemonaceae and is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring a single stamen. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a smooth margin, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
